summary: The video discusses the reputation of nine-banded armadillos, particularly those found in the American South, and their association with carrying leprosy. It explains that while leprosy is an ancient disease, it is now highly curable and weak, thriving at temperatures around 90 degrees, which matches the armadillos' average body temperature. Approximately 20% of Gulf Coast nine-banded armadillos are estimated to carry leprosy, but the risk of transmission to humans is extremely low, less than 10%. The video also mentions that these armadillos are known for digging in yards, eating insects, and frequently being hit by cars.
keywords: armadillos, nine-banded armadillo, American South, leprosy, ancient disease, curable, body temperature, Gulf Coast, transmission risk, digging, eating bugs, road accidents
